item.title: Report X-2025031435
item.description:
Report X-2025031435

Identified by scraper @ 2025-04-15T00:53:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-24
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT APPROXIMATELY 20:45 AN UNLOAD SUPERVISOR CALLED DMP ABOUT A LEAKING PACKAGE IN DOOR 18 OF THE UNLOAD. A DESIGNATED RESPONDER DONNED PROPER PPE AND RETRIEVED A SPILL CART. ONCE ON THE SCENE OF THE SPILL THE RESPONDER NOTICED THE PACKAGE HAD BEEN CRUSHED AND LIQUID WAS LEAKING OUT OF THE CORNER. AFTER REFERRING TO THE DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE RESPONDER ACTED ACCORDINGLY. THE PACKAGE WAS TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. AFTER OPENING THE PACKAGE IT WAS FOUND TO BE LEAKING DUE TO BEING CRUSHED AND THE CAP COMING LOOSE. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN DISPOSED OF ACCORDING TO THE DMP FLOW CHART.

item.title: Report E-2025030463
item.description:
Report E-2025030463

Identified by scraper @ 2025-04-15T00:53:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-04
  • City: ST PETERS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately two (2) gallons of material released from two (2) 1-gallon metal pails due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the pails being crushed. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum along with the metal pails, waste product, and disposed PPE. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025030442
item.description:
Report E-2025030442

Identified by scraper @ 2025-04-15T00:53:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-01
  • City: SAINT LOUIS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0908 ET, Eric Ramey with XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XSL. It was reported that approximately 2 gallons of UN 2586 Naxsoft 98s released from 55-gallon poly drum due to puncture from the skid. The release impacted trailer # 3233888. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are not capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. ERTS will proceed to dispatch a contractor to the site to complete cleanup activities. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-gallons of UN2586 Naxsoft 98S product released, impacting 6’x6’ of the wooden trailer floor due to a nail puncture at the bottom of the drum. The crew utilized absorbents, simple green and water on the impacted areas and confirmed a small area on the dock apron was also impacted and treated the same way. The original punctured drum was overpacked into a 95-gallon poly drum, impacted absorbents, PPE and impacted plywood were containerized into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2025031463
item.description:
Report X-2025031463

Identified by scraper @ 2025-04-15T00:53:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-12
  • City: SAINT LOUIS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Operations Supervisor II Glenn Kidd contacted safety to report a Hazardous Spill. Glenn stated they were unloading trailer 572363 when they noticed a pallet containing 29-lbs pails of UN2880, Calcium hypochlorite, Hydrated, 5.1, PG II had shifted during transit. Glenn stated that the pallet was not secure and when it shifted one pail fell over knocking the lid off resulting in a 5-lbs spillage onto the trailer floor.
